data.message: I wish there was a way to eliminate someone specific from seeing what I write, post, etc.

replies.message: Hi Nancy. You'll find an audience selector tool most places you share status updates, photos and anything else. Just click the tool and select who you want to share something with. Learn more: http://on.fb.me/1uFfxpk. -Chantal
Can't you block the specific someone??
Doesent have something to say or apply if  I don't want one specific person to see my post?

Thanks for your question, Ziah. You'll find an audience selector tool most places you share status updates, photos and anything else. Just click the tool and select who you want to share something with. Learn more: http://on.fb.me/1uFyIzh. -Chantal
Yes you can block specific friends with a radio button type selector(dot)

Well when I send a post to just one person then it shows up for everyone to see and make a comment. If you send it private it goes thru messenger and I'm like everyone else I don't want it. PRIVACY FB PRIVACY!!!!!!!
You're not really answering the question.  if you have 200 friends you have to select 199 to eliminate the one.

Of course you can, it's called a custom status...when posting your status you just change it from public or friends to "friends except" then choose the person(s) you want "eliminated" then hit post and they won't see the status. It's very simple!!!
